title: Methodology for Developing Instructional Design Models: Systematic Procedures and Applications

context.prior_knowledge: Basic instructional design theories and understanding of educational technology concepts
context.additional_context: A course focused on acquiring practical methodologies for developing instructional design models in language education domains.

learning_goals: Learners can systematically derive core components of instructional design models through literature analysis.
Learners can design models according to four dimensions (goals, procedures, validation, application) and a 10-step development process.
Learners can critically evaluate and improve instructional design models to suit changing educational environments.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
